SUPERSONIC.Definition: going faster than the speed of sound

RECAP.Definition: repeat the main points of, summarise

LEGACY CARRIERS.Definition: airlines that have a long history that usually originates at some point in the first half of the 20th century

VASTLY.Definition: to a very great extent or degree

DEREGULATION.Definition: the removal of national control from a business or activity

FEAT.Definition: something that is difficult to achieve

LAUNCH.Definition: the act of sending the aeroplane on its course

BANKRUPT.Definition: was in a state that it couldn't pay its debts

RATION BOOKS.Definition: official documents that allowed them to receive food

COMPETING.Definition: trying to be more successful than the other

PROTOTYPE.Definition: the first version of the plane

BOMBER.Definition: a war aeroplane that dropped bombs

INNOVATIONS.Definition: introductions of new ideas or methods

NON-SUPERSONIC.Definition: not able to go faster than the speed of sound

BOASTS.Definition: uses it as an object to be proud of

BEAK.Definition: the hard, pointed part of a bird's mouth

STEEP.Definition: rising and falling at a sharp angle, almost vertically

LINE OF SIGHT.Definition: an imaginary line from their eyes to the point they were looking at

WING.Definition: one of the long and flat parts on either side of a aeroplane that make it able to fly

NARROWER.Definition: having a smaller distance from one side to the other, thinner

MINIMISED.Definition: reduced it to the smallest possible amount

DRAG.Definition: the force that makes it harder for an aeroplane or other object to travel forward

BOASTED.Definition: used them as something to be proud of

CURVE.Definition: a line that turns continuously and has no straight parts

PRIVILEGE.Definition: advantage only few people have because they are rich

LOBSTER.Definition: an animal that lives in the sea and has a body with a hard covering

CAVIAR.Definition: the eggs of fish eaten as food

APPARENTLY.Definition: as far as we know or obviously

CRUISING.Definition: travelling at a fixed, steady speed

OYSTER.Definition: a flat sea creature that lives in a shell

INTRIGUE.Definition: interesting because of being strange and exciting

GLAMOUR.Definition: excitement and luxury (great and expensive comfort)

SONIC BOOM.Definition: the loud noise caused by an aircraft that travels faster than the speed of sound

SUBJECTED.Definition: caused to experience something not pleasant, put through

ADDING INSULT TO INJURY.Definition: making a bad situation even worse

OZONE LAYER.Definition: the layer of the upper atmosphere where ozone (a form of oxygen) protects the earth from harmful light from the sun

BOUND FOR.Definition: on the way to, headed for

STRUCTURAL.Definition: relating to the parts of its structure or construction

HOLD.Definition: a large place in the lower part of the plane in which items of baggage were kept

FREAK ACCIDENT.Definition: an accident that happens under rare or highly unlikely circumstances

TAXIING.Definition: moving slowly along the ground before take-off

STRIP.Definition: a long thin piece of material

TYRES.Definition: thick, rubber, air-filled material around the edge of the wheel of a vehicle

DOOMED.Definition: certain to have a bad end

PUT THE NAIL IN THE COFFIN.Definition: made it very likely for it to fail

GROUNDED.Definition: kept them on ground or inactive

APPEAL.Definition: quality of being attractive and interesting

CABIN.Definition: the area for passengers in an aeroplane

SUCCESSOR.Definition: something similar that would come after it

SUBSONIC.Definition: slower than the speed of sound
